edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.stores

Interface BlockStore

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FileStore, RemoteFileStore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBlockStore, GlusterFileStore, LocalBlockStore, LocalFileStore, MemoryStore, SerializedMemoryStore

    public interface BlockStore
    Interface for Block placement.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Notifies that all writes for a block is end.

    • Method Detail

      • createBlock

        void createBlock(String blockId)
          throws BlockWriteException
        Creates a new block. A stale data created by previous failed task should be handled during the creation of new block.
        Parameters:
        blockId - the ID of the block to create.
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - for any error occurred while trying to create a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)

      • putPartitions

        <K extends Serializable> Optional<List<Long>> putPartitions(String blockId,
                                                            Iterable<NonSerializedPartition<K>> partitions,
                                                            boolean commitPerPartition)
                                                     throws BlockWriteException
        Saves an iterable of NonSerializedPartitions to a block. If the block exists already, appends the data to it. Invariant: This method may not support concurrent write for a single block. Only one thread have to write at once.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        partitions - to save to a block.
        commitPerPartition - whether commit every partition write or not.
        Returns:
        the size of the data per partition (only when the data is serialized).
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - for any error occurred while trying to write a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)

      • putSerializedPartitions

        <K extends Serializable> List<Long> putSerializedPartitions(String blockId,
                                                            Iterable<SerializedPartition<K>> partitions,
                                                            boolean commitPerPartition)
                                                     throws BlockWriteException
        Saves an iterable of SerializedPartitions to a block. If the block exists already, appends the data to it. Invariant: This method may not support concurrent write for a single block. Only one thread have to write at once.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        partitions - to save to a block.
        commitPerPartition - whether commit every partition write or not.
        Returns:
        the size of the data per partition (only when the data is serialized).
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - for any error occurred while trying to write a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)

      • getPartitions

        <K extends Serializable> Optional<Iterable<NonSerializedPartition<K>>> getPartitions(String blockId,
                                                                                     KeyRange<K> keyRange)
                                                                              throws BlockFetchException
        Retrieves NonSerializedPartitions. They belong to a specific KeyRange from a block.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the target partition.
        keyRange - the key range.
        Returns:
        the result elements from the target block (if the target block exists).
        Throws:
        BlockFetchException - for any error occurred while trying to fetch a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)

      • getSerializedPartitions

        <K extends Serializable> Optional<Iterable<SerializedPartition<K>>> getSerializedPartitions(String blockId,
                                                                                            KeyRange<K> keyRange)
                                                                                     throws BlockFetchException
        Retrieves SerializedPartitions in a specific KeyRange from a block.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the target block.
        keyRange - the key range.
        Returns:
        the result elements from the target block (if the target block exists).
        Throws:
        BlockFetchException - for any error occurred while trying to fetch a partition. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)

      • commitBlock

        void commitBlock(String blockId)
          throws BlockWriteException
        Notifies that all writes for a block is end. Subscribers waiting for the data of the target block are notified when the block is committed. Also, further subscription about a committed block will not blocked but get the data in it and finished.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - if fail to commit. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)

      • removeBlock

        Boolean removeBlock(String blockId)
        Removes a block of data.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        Returns:
        whether the partition exists or not.
        Throws:
        BlockFetchException - for any error occurred while trying to remove a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)
